accessibilityNote:
CommandPost makes use of the built-in macOS Accessibility Frameworks
to control other applications, such as Final Cut Pro.

To continue, please press Allow Accessibility below and
follow the prompts to allow CommandPost accessibility access.

advancedFeaturesWarning:
The below options are hidden Final Cut Pro preferences.
If enabled, they'll remain enabled even if CommandPost is not running.
Trashing your Final Cut Pro preferences will reset these preferences too.
Please use with care, as there's a reason Apple hasn't exposed them.
afterEffectsShortcutDescription: Triggers a shortcut key within After Effects.
allowScriptsTurnedOff: "Allow Scripts to Write Files and Access Network" is turned off in After Effects.
allowScriptsTurnedOffDescription:
CommandPost requires permission to write files within After Effects, so that it can save a list of all your installed plugins.

Please turn on this preference in the "Scripting & Expressions" tab of Preferences and try again.
allowZoomingWithModifierKey: Enable Timeline Zooming with Mouse Scroll & Modifier Key
alreadyWatched: This folder is already being watched.
aNewFCPXMLHasBeenExportedSuccessfully: A new FCPXML has been exported successfully.
apiKeysValidated: Your API keys you entered have been successfully validated.
appendSelectedTitleTextwithPasteboardCon: Append Selected Title Text with Pasteboard Contents
applyColorCorrectionFromPreviousClip: Apply Color Correction from Previous Clip
applyColorCorrectionFromThreeClipsBack: Apply Color Correction from Three Clips Back
applyColorCorrectionFromTwoClipsBack: Apply Color Correction from Two Clips Back
areYouConnectedToTheInternet: Are you actually connected to the Internet?
areYouSureTheresSomethingOnThePasteboard: Are you sure there's something in the Final Cut Pro Pasteboard?
areYouSureTheXMLIsValid: Are you sure the XML is valid?
areYouSureYouWantToStoreYourSettingsOnTh: Are you sure you want to store your settings on the Loupedeck CT Flash Drive?

Enabling this option will tell CommandPost to read and write the settings to and from the connected Loupedeck CT's internal Flash Drive.

If your Loupedeck CT has settings already stored on it, those settings will overwrite whatever is locally stored on your Mac. However, for safety, before they're overwritten they will be backed up with today's date and time in CommandPost's Settings Folder.

If there are no existing settings on the Loupedeck CT Flash Drive, then the settings from the Mac will be copied to the Loupedeck CT.
Are you sure you want to store your settings on the Loupedeck Live Flash Drive?

Enabling this option will tell CommandPost to read and write the settings to and from the connected Loupedeck Live's internal Flash Drive.

If your Loupedeck Live has settings already stored on it, those settings will overwrite whatever is locally stored on your Mac. However, for safety, before they're overwritten they will be backed up with today's date and time in CommandPost's Settings Folder.

If there are no existing settings on the Loupedeck Live Flash Drive, then the settings from the Mac will be copied to the Loupedeck Live.
assignClipAudioRoleToVoiceName: Assign Clip Audio Role to Voice Name
atLeastOneBrowserClipMustBeSelected: At least one clip must be selected in the browser to use this feature.
attachLog: Attach the entire contents of the CommandPost Debug Console.
attachScreenshot: Attach a screenshot of all of your screens, taken just before this feedback form appeared.
audioSwiftDescriptionOne: AudioSwift allows you to use your MacBook Pro Trackpad and Magic Trackpad as a control surface.
audioSwiftDescriptionThree: You can setup AudioSwift in the MIDI Preferences Panel using the 'Learn' feature.
audioSwiftDescriptionTwo: It has several modes, so you can use it for sliders, buttons and two axis controls (such as for colour wheels).
autoMountOnAC: Mount external drives when switching to AC power
autoSequenceDescriptionOne: When you drag a Final Cut Pro Project to this Toolbox, we'll send a new Project back to Final Cut Pro with the clips sorted by timecode.
autoSequenceDescriptionTwo: This Toolbox was thrown together for Knut Hake & Sam Pluemacher.
autoSequenceError: Please make sure you drag in a Project with all the clips located on the primary storyline. Do not drag in an Event or a Library.
autoUnmountOnBattery: Unmount external drives when switching to battery power
badCSVFileForVimeoToolbox:
This CSV file does not contain the contents we expect from Vimeo.

Please check the contents of the file and try again.

If you're still having issues importing a CSV file from Vimeo, please contact the CommandPost developers.
badLoupedeckIcon: Only supported image files (JPEG, PNG, TIFF, GIF or BMP) can be dragged and dropped here.
badLoupedeckIconTip: However, you can click the Drop Zone to import the icons from Application files.
badStreamDeckIcon: Only supported image files (JPEG, PNG, TIFF, GIF or BMP) are allowed as Stream Deck icons.
badTouchBarIcon: Only supported image files (JPEG, PNG, TIFF, GIF or BMP) are allowed as Touch Bar icons.
batchExportBackgroundTasksDetected:
Incomplete background tasks were detected, which has aborted the Batch Export.

Background tasks can be ignored via the Batch Export Preferences if required.
batchExportComplete:
Batch Export is now complete.

The selected clips have been added to your Final Cut Pro export queue.
batchExportCompressorComplete:
Batch Export is now complete.

The selected clips have been added to your Compressor Batch ready for processing.
batchExportDestinationDisabled:
The Target destination you have selected is disabled in the menubar, which has aborted the Batch Export.

Please try again.
batchExportInvalidCaptionsDetected:
Captions or subtitles with unresolved validation errors were detected, which has aborted the Batch Export.

Invalid Captions can be ignored via the Batch Export Preferences if required.
batchExportMissingFilesAndBadCaptionsDet:
Missing or offline titles, effects or generators as well as captions or subtitles with unresolved validation errors were detected, which has aborted the Batch Export.

Missing & Offline Effects and Invalid Captions can be ignored via the Batch Export Preferences if required.
batchExportMissingFilesDetected:
Missing or offline titles, effects or generators were detected, which has aborted the Batch Export.

Missing & Offline Effects can be ignored via the Batch Export Preferences if required.
batchExportNoDestination:
It doesn't look like you have a Default Destination selected.

You can set a Default Destination by going to 'Preferences', clicking the 'Destinations' tab, right-clicking on the Destination you would like to use and then click 'Make Default'.

You can set a Batch Export Destination Preset via the CommandPost menubar.
batchExportNotShowing:
Unable to show the Export Dialog, which has aborted the Batch Export.

Please try again.
batchExportProxyFilesDetected:
Proxy files were detected, which has aborted the Batch Export.

Proxy files can be ignored via the Batch Export Preferences if required.
batchExportUnexpectedAlert:
An unexpected alert appeared while opening the Export dialog.

Please try again.
batchRenameBrowserFail:
The Batch Rename tool could not open the Browser.

Please open the Browser and try again.

createTitlesFromTextDescription: This is a helpful tool that allows you to create a new Final Cut Pro Project which contains a new Title for every line in the below two text boxes.
csvExportedSuccessfullyImagesCouldNotBeC: The CSV has been exported successfully, however some of the images could not be consolidated. Please check the Debug Console for specific error messages.

daVinciResolveControlSurfaceResetApplica: This will reset all DaVinci Resolve Control Surface items in the current application to the default values.
daVinciResolveControlSurfaceResetBankCon: This will reset all DaVinci Resolve Control Surface items in the current bank to the default values.
daVinciResolveControlSurfaceResetDeviceC: This will reset all DaVinci Resolve Control Surface items of the same device type to the default values.
daVinciResolveControlSurfaceResetEveryth: This will reset all DaVinci Resolve Control Surface items across all devices to the default values.
daVinciResolveControlSurfaceResetUnitCon: This will reset all DaVinci Resolve Control Surface items for this particular unit to the default values.
daVinciResolveControlSurfaceTip:
DaVinci Resolve will totally override CommandPost when running, even if DaVinci Resolve is just running in the background.
These features have been tested with Editor Keyboard Firmware v1.4 and Speed Editor Firmware v1.4.1.
Whilst CommandPost does support Bluetooth connections, we strongly recommend using a wired connection.

fcpxmlTitlesProcessorDescriptionLineTwo: You can also Batch Process an entire folder. To do this, the FCPXML and CSV filenames need to be identical.

loupedeckCTResetAllConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck CT items across all applications to the default values.
loupedeckCTResetApplicationConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck CT items in the current application to the default values.
loupedeckCTResetBankConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck CT items in the current bank to the default values.
loupedeckCTStoreSettingsOnFlashDriveLine: Store settings on Flash Drive is enabled, but no Loupedeck CT is detected.
Please connect your Loupedeck CT to allow configuration.
loupedeckLiveResetAllConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck Live items across all applications to the default values.
loupedeckLiveResetApplicationConfirmatio: This will reset all Loupedeck Live items in the current application to the default values.
loupedeckLiveResetBankConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck Live items in the current bank to the default values.
loupedeckLiveSResetAllConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck Live-S items across all applications to the default values.
loupedeckLiveSResetApplicationConfirmati: This will reset all Loupedeck Live-S items in the current application to the default values.
loupedeckLiveSResetBankConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck Live-S items in the current bank to the default values.
loupedeckLiveStoreSettingsOnFlashDriveLi: Store settings on Flash Drive is enabled, but no Loupedeck Live is detected.
Please connect your Loupedeck Live to allow configuration.
loupedeckPluginFavouriteDescription: You can assign any action in CommandPost to a Favourite below, which is then accessible in the Official Loupedeck App.
loupedeckPluginIsActiveExplanation:
When CommandPost's Loupedeck Plugin is enabled, you cannot use CommandPost to talk to the hardware directly.

Please disable the Loupedeck Plugin if you wish to use CommandPost instead of the official Loupedeck application.
loupedeckPluginPreferencesDescription: CommandPost allows you to install a plugin into the official Loupedeck application so that you can access CommandPost's actions within it.
loupedeckPluginTip: If you enable the Loupedeck Plugin, CommandPost's native Loupedeck CT and Live support will be disabled.
loupedeckPluginTipTwo: This features requires Loupedeck Software v5.1 or later.
loupedeckResetAllConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck+ items across all applications to the default values.
loupedeckResetGroupConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck+ items in the current application to the default values.
loupedeckResetSubGroupConfirmation: This will reset all Loupedeck+ items in the current bank to the default values.
luaCodeCouldNotBeProcessed: The Lua code could not be processed.
macOSShortcutsDescriptions: Triggers a shortcut from the macOS Shortcuts app
macOSShortcutsDisabledSearchConsoleMessa: You can enable it from the Shortcuts panel in CommandPost's Preferences
macOSShortcutsPreferencesPanelDescriptio:
CommandPost can allow you to trigger any shortcuts that you have in the macOS Shortcuts application.
This feature requires CommandPost to have Automation permission for 'Shortcuts Events' in System Preferences.
macosShortcutsSetupMessage:
CommandPost requires a Automation permission
to list shortcuts from the macOS Shortcuts app in the Search Console.

This is optional. If you click Enable Shortcuts, you may be prompted for permission
if CommandPost hasn't already asked previously. You can change this permission at any time by visiting the System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy > Automation panel.
menuItemsLoading: The menu items will populate once the selected application is opened and scanned.
midiColorBoardDescription: Controls the Color Board via MIDI Controls
midiControlColorWheel: Hold down SHIFT to change value at extended range.
midiPositionInvertedDescription: Hold SHIFT for double, OPTION for triple.
midiResetAllConfirmation: This will reset all MIDI items across all applications to the default values.
midiResetGroupConfirmation: This will reset all MIDI items in the current application to the default values.
midiResetSubGroupConfirmation: This will reset all MIDI items in the current bank to the default values.
midiTimelineZoomDescription: Allows you to control timeline zoom via MIDI controls.
midiTopDeviceToAll: This will apply the MIDI device on the top of the list to all the subsequent lines for the current application.
monogramFavouriteDescription: You can assign any action in CommandPost to a Favourite below, which is then accessible in the Monogram Creator.
monogramPreferencesDescription:
CommandPost uses the official Monogram Creator API to allow users to control both legacy Palette modules and the latest Monogram modules, such as Orbiter.

Monogram support requires Monogram Creator 4.1.11 or later.

mustInstallTangentMapper: You must install the Tangent Mapper & Hub to enable Tangent Panel support.

needUserAndAppAPIKey: You must supply both a User & Application API key to continue.

outroText:
You can access CommandPost via the control surface icon
in your system’s menubar at the top right corner of the screen.

You can move the menubar icon to your preferred position
by dragging with the COMMAND key held down.
outroTitle: CommandPost is now setup and ready to go!

pasteboardHistory_TimelineEmptyInfo: Nothing is currently loaded into the Timeline.
pasteboardToMarkers_title: Paste Markers to Selected Clip in Browser from Pasteboard
pasteboardToMarkersCompleted: Copying Pasteboard Markers to Selected Clip in Browser has completed successfully.
pasteboardToMarkersFailed:
The pasteboard doesn't contain any text in the required format to process.

You should use the following syntax:

05:00:00: Test Keyword 1
#05:01:00:01: Test Keyword 2
*05:02:00: Test Keyword 3
05:02:15: Test Keyword 4
*05:03:00: Test Keyword 5
05:03:15: Test Keyword 6
#05:03:30: Test Keyword 7
*05:04:00: Test Keyword 8

If a * is place before the timecode, it will make the clip as a favourite between the current timecode value and the next timecode value.

If a # is place before the timecode, it will create a 'To Do' marker.

pluginCacheDescription:
CommandPost keeps a list of all the installed Final Cut Pro Motion Templates, so that it can display them in the Search Console.

If an effect, transition, title or generator is missing from the Search Console, you can re-scan your system for new Motion Templates.
pluginsCustomFolderDetails: Custom Plugins can also be saved in the Plugins Folder.
pluginsDisableCheck: Are you sure you want to disable this plugin?
pluginsEnableCheck: Are you sure you want to enable this plugin?
pluginsPanelDescription: CommandPost is made up of many Lua-based plugins, all contained within the CommandPost application bundle. Plugins could contain, for example, an individual action (such as the scrolling timeline in Final Cut Pro), or might be a manager for a control surface, such as a Loupedeck+. If you need to, you can disable specific plugins below. However, there are some plugins which are required, and not able to be disabled because they provide core functionality, such as generating the menubar icon. You can also add your own Custom Plugins, allowing you to add new features, or modify existing ones.
pluginsRestart: If you continue, CommandPost will need to restart.

scanAfterEffectsDescription: CommandPost will now scan After Effects to generate a list of installed plugins.
scanAfterEffectsDescriptionTwo: This process requires After Effects to be open, and can take several minutes.
scanFinalCutProSetupOne: CommandPost needs to scan your system for Final Cut Pro Plugins & Motion Templates.

screenRecordingNote:
CommandPost requires Screen Recording permission to detect the state of various user interface elements - for example, to detect when Final Cut Pro is playing or stopped. We also allow users to optionally share screenshots when submitting feedback.

To continue, please press Allow Screen Recording, which will open System Preferences allowing you to grant CommandPost Screen Recording permission. CommandPost will automatically restart once granted permission.
scrubTimelineDescription: Allows you to move the playhead one frame left or right.
searchAbortedDescription:
The search failed to find anything after searching 500 cells, so it has been aborted.

You can try using a Smart Collection or use the 'Filter Browser Before Search' option in the HUD Search Panel to narrow your selection in the Browser.

settingsDescription:
In a future release of CommandPost we will have a proper import/export feature for settings.
In the meantime you can manually copy and paste settings between machines via Finder.
You can also setup a sym-link so that the settings folder points to a Dropbox or iCloud Drive folder allowing you to share settings between machines.

shotDataDescriptionFive: The images will be renamed based on the Scene and Shot number in the connected Shot Data Title.
shotDataDescriptionFour: on the timeline (but not in a secondary storyline), these images will be consolidated into the same folder as the CSV.
shotDataDescriptionOne: This utility allows you to import a FCPXML which contains one or more Shot Data Titles in a timeline, and converts
shotDataDescriptionSix: This utility was commissioned by Vigneswaran Rajkumar, and is powered by CSV2Notion Neo (a fork of Vladilen Zhdanov's csv2notion).
shotDataDescriptionThree: If you have a Shot Data Title on the Primary Storyline, and have a single still image connected directly to it
shotDataDescriptionTwo: the data from these Motion Templates into a single CSV file for use in other applications.
shotDataDropZone: You can drag and drop projects from the Final Cut Pro Browser to here for processing...
shotDataExportDestinationDescription: Your Shot Data files will be saved to
shotDataFailedToInstallTemplate: Failed to install Shot Data Template.
shotDataFailedToInstallTemplateDescripti: CommandPost was unable to install the Shot Data Motion Template. This is most likely a permissions issue.
shotDataFCPXMLFailedDescription: CommandPost was unable to process the FCPXML. Please make sure the FCPXML contains a single timeline, which contains the Shot Data Titles.
shotDataInstalledSuccessfullyDescription: The Shot Data Title has been added to the CommandPost folder within Final Cut Pro.
shotDataInstallMotionTemplate: Are you sure you want to install the latest Shot Data Motion Template?
shotDataInstallMotionTemplateDescription: Clicking OK will install the latest Shot Data Motion Template into Final Cut Pro, replacing any previous versions. You can find it in the CommandPost section of Final Cut Pro's Titles browser.

snippetAlreadyExists: A Snippet with this name already exists.
snippetEnterLabel: Please enter a unique label for the snippet:
snippetError: The following error occurred when executing this snippet
snippetExecuteError: The Snippet could not be executed successfully.
snippetsDescription:
Code Snippets are simple Lua scripts, that can be easily thrown together, shared around, and triggered via actions.
For example, a snippet can be triggered via the Search Console. This allows you to quickly code things without creating a plugin.
snippetUniqueName: Please enter a new unique label and try again.
sonyTimecodeError: Please make sure you drag a Project into this Toolbox. Do not drag in an Event or Library.
sonyTimecodeRepairDescriptionFive: This Toolbox was thrown together for Alister Robbie. Thanks George Elias, Jamie LeJeune & Valerio D'Andrassi.
sonyTimecodeRepairDescriptionFour: This Toolbox supports both Drop Frame (29.97fps, 59.94fps, 119.88fps) and Non-Drop Frame Timecode (i.e 24fps, 25fps, 120fps, etc).
sonyTimecodeRepairDescriptionOne: Final Cut Pro currently doesn't correctly interpret timecode from certain Sony Cameras that are recording into an MP4 wrapper.
sonyTimecodeRepairDescriptionThree: so that you can more easily send timelines from Final Cut Pro to DaVinci Resolve, Baselight or Adobe Premiere (with XtoCC).
sonyTimecodeRepairDescriptionTwo: This Toolbox will update a Project's FCPXML to use the correct timecode values from the XML sidecar file (or the MP4 itself if no sidecar file exists),
spotifyCommandDescription: Triggers a Spotify Command via AppleScript
startingWorkflowExtensionDescription: Please wait for the Workflow Extension to load...

streamDeckAppRunningMessage: This must be closed to activate Stream Deck support in CommandPost.
streamDeckAppTip: The official Stream Deck application is not compatible with CommandPost and can't be used at the same time.
streamDeckResetApplicationConfirmation: This will reset all Stream Deck items in the current application to the default values.
streamDeckResetBankConfirmation: This will reset all Stream Deck items in the current bank to the default values.
streamDeckResetDeviceConfirmation: This will reset all Stream Deck items of the same device type to the default values.
streamDeckResetEverythingConfirmation: This will reset all Stream Deck items across all devices to the default values.
streamDeckResetUnitConfirmation: This will reset all Stream Deck items for this particular unit to the default values.

switchDaVinciResolveControlSurfaceTo: Switch DaVinci Resolve Control Surface to
tangentActionDescription: Emulates a Tangent Element button, knob or wheel. At least one physical Tangent panel must be connected.
tangentFavouriteDescription: You can assign any action in CommandPost to a Favourite below, which is then accessible in the Tangent Mapper.
tangentFinalCutProShortcutFailed:
There is no shortcut key applied to this command, so the command cannot be triggered.

Please open up the Final Cut Pro Command Editor and assign a shortcut key to the command, then try again.
tangentMapperNotFoundMessage:
The Tangent Mapper application could not be found.

Please download the latest version from the Tangent website and try again.
tangentPreferencesInfo: CommandPost offers native support of the entire range of Tangent's panels, including the Element, Wave & Wave2, Ripple, Arc, CP-200, the Element-Vs iPad & Android app, as well as any future panels that Tangent releases.
tangentTip: To get full functionality CommandPost requires Tangent Hub v1.6.4 or newer.
textInspectorCouldNotBeShown: Text Inspector could not be shown.

theCSVHasBeenExportedSuccessfully: The CSV has been exported successfully.
theOriginalAndNewColumnsCannotBeTheSameP: The original and new columns cannot be the same. Please check your settings and try again.
theSharedFolderCouldNotBeFound: The Shared Folder could not be found.
theSuppliedFCPXMLDidNotPassDtdValidation: The supplied FCPXML did not pass DTD validation. Please check that the FCPXML supplied is valid and try again.
thisWillOnlyTriggerThePauseShortcutKeyIf: This will only trigger the pause shortcut key if already playing.
thisWillOnlyTriggerThePlayShortcutKeyIfA: This will only trigger the play shortcut key if already stopped.
timelineBatchExportBeginMessage:
This Timeline Batch Export Tool uses automation to select each clip individually, then triggers the 'File > Share' menu item.

Please do not move the mouse or touch the keyboard until this process is complete.

The 'Enable Rendering During Playback' preference will be disabled until the Batch Export is completed to improve performance.

If you have a slower machine, or are exporting a lot of clips, Final Cut Pro may struggle to keep up - in which case, you might have more success using this tool to 'Send to Compressor', as you actually transcoding will only take place when you begin the export queue.

As an alterative to CommandPost, you can also use the Frame.io App - however this can be much slower on large timelines, as it exports the whole timeline first.
timelineBatchExportCompressorBeginMessag:
This Timeline Batch Export Tool uses automation to select each clip individually, then triggers the 'File > Send to Compressor' menu item.

Please do not move the mouse or touch the keyboard until this process is complete.
title: Title
titlesToKeywordsDescriptionFour: This will happen automatically if you only have one library open, otherwise you'll be prompted to select a library to import it into.
titlesToKeywordsDescriptionOne: When you drag a Final Cut Pro Event to this Toolbox (which must only contain a single Project), we will look through all the Titles connected
titlesToKeywordsDescriptionSix: This Toolbox was thrown together for Knut Hake & Sam Pluemacher.
titlesToKeywordsDescriptionThree: for each of those Titles, including any connected clips. We then send that data back into Final Cut Pro as a new Event with a ✅ prefix.
titlesToKeywordsDescriptionTwo: to the clips in the Primary Storyline, read the name of those clips (as they appear in the Timeline Index), then create new Keyword Ranges
titlesToMarkersNoTitlesDetected: Please make sure you drag in an Event which contains a single Project, with Titles attached to clips in the Primary Storyline. Do not drag in a Project or a Library.
toEnableTheFlashDriveOnLoupedeckCT: To enable the Flash drive you need to restart your device by disconnecting it from your computer and reconnecting it.
toEnableTheFlashDriveOnLoupedeckLive: To enable the Flash drive you need to restart your device by disconnecting it from your computer and reconnecting it.
toggleDaVinciResolveControlSurfaceSuppor: Toggle DaVinci Resolve Control Surface Support
toggleOpacityFadeHandlesInVideoAnimation: Toggle Opacity Fade Handles in Video Animation Popup on Selected Clips
Due to a Final Cut Pro bug this doesn't work for clips in a Secondary Storyline
toggleVideoScopesInEventViewer: Toggle Video Scopes in Event Viewer
toolboxDescriptionOne: The toolbox is an evolving collection of handy utilities commissioned by members of the CommandPost community to do very specific tasks, generally related to XML processing.
toolboxDescriptionTwo: If there's something you or your company would like to automate, then you can contact the CommandPost team for advice and a quote.
touchBarColorBoardDescription: Allows you to control the %{panel} Panel of the Color Board.
touchBarColorBoardGroupedDescription: Color Board Panel Toggle Button & 4 x Puck Controls.
touchBarColorBoardPuckDescription: Allows you to control puck %{puck} of the Color Board.
touchBarDragTip: If Draggable is selected, you can hold down the left OPTION key to drag.
touchBarDuplicateWidget: The selected Touch Bar widget is already in use.
touchBarDuplicateWidgetInfo: An individual Touch Bar widget can only be used once on your custom Touch Bar. Please select a different widget and try again, or remove the original instance of the widget.
touchBarError:
Virtual Touch Bar support requires macOS 10.12.1 (Build 16B2657) or later.

Please update macOS and try again.
touchBarResetConfirmation: This will reset all modified Touch Bar items to the default values.
touchBarResetGroupConfirmation: This will reset all the Touch Bar items in the current application to the default values.
touchBarResetSubGroupConfirmation: This will reset all the Touch Bar items in the current bank to the default values.
touchBarSetupTip:
Make sure "App Controls with Control Strip" is selected within the "Touch Bar shows" Keyboard System Preferences to see the CommandPost icon.
You can then tap this icon to toggle through the different Touch Bar groups.
tourBoxAppTip: The official TourBox application is not compatible with CommandPost and can't be used at the same time.
tourBoxRequirementsTip: These features are compatible with the firmware that's bundled with TourBox Console Version 2.1.
tourBoxResetAllConfirmation: This will reset all TourBox items across all applications to the default values.
tourBoxResetApplicationConfirmation: This will reset all TourBox items in the current application to the default values.
tourBoxResetBankConfirmation: This will reset all TourBox items in the current bank to the default values.
treatFavoriteAndRejectAsRatingsInsteadOf: Treat FAVORITE and REJECT as Ratings instead of Keywords
triggerAVirtualMouseScrollWheelEvent: Trigger a virtual mouse scroll wheel event
trimToggleDescription: Hold down MIDI button for Trim Tool, then release for Select Tool.
updateEffectsListFailed: Unfortunately the Effects List was not successfully updated.
uploadToNotionDescription: You can also optionally upload all your Shot Data information to an online Notion Database.
useBetterQualityInAnglesViewer: Use Better Quality in Angles Viewer (requires restart)
useSnippetToSetLEDColor: Use Snippet to Set LED Color
useSnippetToToggleLEDStatus: Use Snippet to Toggle LED Status
useTitleContentsInsteadOfTitleName: Use Title Contents Instead of Title Name
vimeoMarkerConverterDescriptionOne: This tool imports a Vimeo Review CSV file into Final Cut Pro.
vimeoMarkerConverterDescriptionTwo: This was thrown together for Gary Roll, Adam Olivero & Scott Simmons.
waitingForFCPXMLToBeProcessed: Waiting for FCPXML to be processed
watchFolderAddFinderTag: If you want to add a Finder Tag to any %{type} Files that are added to this Watch Folder please enter it below, or press OK to skip:
watchFolderCompressorHelp: This feature allows you to automatically transcode files with Compressor when they're added to any of the below Watch Folders.
watchFolderFCPMediaHelp:
This feature allows you to recieve macOS notfications whenever supported files are added into any of the below watch folders.
From the notification you can then Import these files directly to your current Final Cut Pro timeline.
If you hold down SHIFT when pressing Import, it will import all the outstanding files.
watchFolderFCPMediaTooltip: Final Cut Pro Media Watch Folder Preferences
watchFolderFCPXMLTooltip: Final Cut Pro XML Watch Folder Preferences
watchFolderXMLHelp:
This feature allows you to recieve macOS notfications whenever a FCPXML file is added into any of the below watch folders.
From the notification you can then Import these files directly to your current Final Cut Pro timeline.
If you hold down SHIFT when pressing Import, it will import all the outstanding files.
whatDidYouExpectToHappen: What did you expect to happen?
whatFeatures: What feature would you like to see implemented or improved?
whatStepsToRecreate: What are the steps to recreate the problem?
workflowExtensionMovePlayhead: Moves the Final Cut Pro playhead via the Workflow Extension API
youCannotDragItemsBetweenDifferentContro: You cannot drag items between different control types.
Currently you can only drag items of the same control type (i.e. button to button, or knob to knob). Please try again.
zoomSliderDescription: Allows you to control timeline zoom.
